decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Adventure mechanic from Throne of Eldraine to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck focuses on quickly generating value from adventure creatures like Beanstalk Giant and Bonecrusher Giant, while also using Lucky Clover to double up on adventure triggers. Fae of Wishes provides additional utility by allowing the player to fetch specific answers from their sideboard. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful spells, all while maintaining a strong mana base for consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Adventure mechanic and Lucky Clover to generate card advantage and ramp up into powerful threats like Beanstalk Giant and Lovestruck Beast. The goal is to have a strong aggressive early game while also having the flexibility to answer threats with cards like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant. Fae of Wishes provides additional utility by allowing access to a sideboard that can provide answers to a variety of situations. Escape to the Wilds serves as a powerful card advantage engine to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, while also utilizing Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for extra value. The win condition is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon, while also utilizing cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Omen of the Sun to maintain board presence. This deck aims to out-value the opponent and grind out a victory through resource management and efficient plays.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and dictating the pace of the game by using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. Utilizing cards like Agent of Treachery, Shark Typhoon, and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value and card advantage. By including Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck can maximize its potential with additional blink and enter the battlefield effects. Overall, the key idea is to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient spells and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. By playing cards such as Narset, Teferi, and Fires of Invention, the deck can control the tempo of the game and prevent the opponent from advancing their board state. The deck also includes ways to generate tokens and manipulate the top of the deck with cards like Omen of the Sun and Castle Vantress. Finally, the deck looks to finish off the opponent by stealing their best threats with Agent of Treachery or overwhelming them with Shark Typhoon tokens.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful control spells for free, while generating value with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. It aims to control the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, eventually overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion for additional value and consistency in the long game, creating a resilient and powerful control deck in the standard 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, while also taking advantage of the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. The deck aims to generate card advantage with Yorion, Sky Nomad and value creatures like Agent of Treachery, while using removal spells like Solar Blaze and Shatter the Sky to deal with opposing threats. The deck also includes card draw and token generation to maintain board presence and outvalue the opponent over the course of the game.

The strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shatter the Sky. The deck also focuses on card advantage and disruption with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Agent of Treachery. Additionally, the deck includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide additional value and synergy with cards like Omen of the Sun and Elspeth Conquers Death. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until achieving victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. By using cards like Narset, Teferi, and Lukka, the deck can dig for key pieces while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes a blink strategy with Yorion and Omen of the Sun, providing additional value and protection. The goal is to stall the game with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Glass Casket until the deck can take over with powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through the powerful Fires of Invention enchantment, allowing you to cast spells for free once per turn. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shatter the Sky, you can control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery to help close out the game. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game and outvalue your opponent through efficient spellcasting and strong late-game threats.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy using a combination of sacrifice effects and recurring small creatures to deal damage quickly and maintain board presence. The key concept is to constantly apply pressure on the opponent by utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Priest of Forgotten Gods to disrupt their game plan, while efficiently utilizing graveyard recursion and sacrifice synergies with cards like Cauldron Familiar and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless onslaught of creatures and incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures like Fervent Champion and Bonecrusher Giant while using burn spells like Shock and Phoenix of Ash to control the board and finish off the opponent. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an extra layer of damage output to help secure victories in a swift and aggressive manner.

The focus of this deck is to establish a strong board presence with low-cost creatures like Healer's Hawk and Gingerbrute, buffed by enchantments such as Sentinel's Eyes and All That Glitters. Karametra's Blessing and Gods Willing provide protection for key creatures, while Season of Growth helps draw through the deck quickly. Lurrus of the Dream-Den can be utilized for repeated value. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with quick, evasive damage and efficient card advantage to maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw. By utilizing cards like Mystical Dispute, Growth Spiral, and Wilderness Reclamation, the player can maintain board control while advancing their own game plan. The key strategy is to use these control tools to outlast the opponent, ultimately winning through a combination of spell-based damage and powerful finishers like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistency in casting the necessary spells while also providing flexibility in land types.

The deck is focused on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, generating card advantage, and managing tempo with efficient removal and powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The mana base is set up to support casting spells of multiple colors, allowing for flexibility in answers to different threats. By utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Expansion / Explosion, the deck aims to outvalue opponents in the late game while maintaining control throughout the match.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, board wipes, and planeswalkers to slow down the opponent's game plan and ultimately take over the game with big threats like Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through synergies with Yorion, Sky Nomad and various card draw effects. By effectively managing resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this UW Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a Standard 1 vs 1 match.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using counterspells, removal, and card advantage from powerful enchantments and planeswalkers. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, stabilize the board with board wipes, and generate card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents and generating card advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control elements and card advantage engines.
